item.title: Wuthering Waves: How To Get The Rider Mount Echo (We Promise, We Deliver Quest Walkthrough)
item.description:
Compared to other open-world RPG games, Wuthering Waves brings a new look to combat mechanics and character equipment. The game incorporates abilities called Echos, enemies that can give Resonators additional stats and skills in battle . The characters either turn into monsters and attack, or use specific skills listed in the monster's data.

There is one specific Echo Boss in Wuthering Waves that players can farm to use its machine. The Inferno Rider is an Overlord Boss that can only be unlocked through the Exploration Quest: We Promise, We Deliver . The quest is quite lengthy and filled with rewards for Rovers. At the end, you can unlock the boss, claim the rewards, and equip its motorcycle to help you get around Solaris-3.

4:20
Related
Wuthering Waves: All Scar's Questions And Answers

Scar allows Rovers to collect clues in Qichi Village and expect them to answer his questions in Wuthering Waves.

We Promise, We Deliver Quest Location In Wuthering Waves

The We Promise, We Deliver quest can be unlocked after interacting with the bulletin board in Jinzhou. You can teleport to the Resonance Beacon near the marker to reach it. Whilst you investigate the warrant notice, an NPC named Dr. Woodrow will approach you for a discussion. This will eventually lead you to check your mailbox for a letter from Lollo Logistics .

This will take you to the Jinzhou branch, where you will meet Tang Manliu and Mimika. After that, you will be teleported to the outskirts of the Sea of Flames. This new area is dangerous, since your character will be continuously affected by Burn.

Entering The Sea Of Flames

How To Survive The Burn Effect

Counteracting the Burn effect is only possible by using the various structures around the area. This is very similar to the children's game known as "The Floor is Lava," in which touching the floor is forbidden. As long as you hop onto items and structures and don't stay on the ground for too long, you’ll be able to survive.

In addition to the burn effect, there are multiple Tacet Discords (TDs) in the area. Since close-range combat will be difficult, it is recommended to equip Pistol users like Chixiai or Mortefi in your party to get rid of any troublesome ones.

Battling The Inferno Rider

You will eventually navigate to Mimika’s touchpad, where the Inferno Rider will be waiting. Keep in mind that you can only use the Rover during this fight . This will be a short fight, because as soon as the Inferno Rider puts up an unbreakable shield , it will automatically end.

Related
Wuthering Waves: Lingyang Build Guide

Lingyang the Suan'ni has a unique but complicated mechanism where he fights mid-air in Wuthering Waves.

Search For The SOS

After following the quest navigation, talk to Mimika to find out that there is indeed a person stranded in the Sea of Flames. Mimika will be near the Port City of Guixu Resonance Nexus . Teleport to the entrance of the Sea of Flames and head inside the Abandoned Research Facility to find Yuni.

Abandoned Research Facility Puzzles

The Shooting Puzzle

You need to complete all stages of this puzzle to gain the trust of the Exiles. This will be a shooting puzzle where players will interact with a cannon and must hit a set number of targets within a limited time. This puzzle comes in three waves. After winning each round, you can talk to the rest of Yuni’s allies.

The quest navigation will show you where the next Abandoned Research Facility is. It will be located near the Resonance Nexus, where you will have to fight some Exile mobsters. Talk to the good Exiles, and they will point you in the direction of the next part of this sub-quest: the flamethrower puzzle.

The Fire Thrower Puzzle

Completing this puzzle will require the use of the Levitator in your Utility box. Players need to fix the broken pipe that is divided between the three rooms. The middle room is the one that houses the flaming device, so if you ever get confused, use that as a marker. The puzzle has three L-shaped pipes and two straight ones :

  • One straight pipe needs to be fitted into a gap in the middle room. You will find this pipe right next to the flame device in the middle room.
  • Then, pick up the L-shaped pipe from the middle room and head to the room on the right. A few steps ahead from the straight pipe slot, there will be another gap. Fit the L-shaped pipe into that gap and make sure it is angled correctly. It needs to connect to the middle room.
  • Next, head over to the room on the left and pick up the straight pipe . Carry this pipe to the room on the right and affix it in the gap you saw before. A small cutscene should play, which is your indicator that you have successfully connected the pipes in the middle and right rooms.
  • Go back to the room on the right and pick up the L-shaped pipe you see near the doorway. Carry that over to the left room and affix it on the first gap you see.
  • The last L-shaped pipe will be at the far end of the room on the right . Once you pick it up, head back over to the room on the left and affix it at an angle so that the left room and middle room connect. If done right, another cutscene should play and you will have completed the puzzle.

After activating the puzzle, you can claim the rewards before heading on to the next mission.

Pressure Plate Puzzle

For this one, you will have to defeat some Exile mobsters at another camp and retrieve a filter. Defeating the mobsters will activate a pressure plate. As soon as you stand on the first one, four more will appear, and you’ll have to complete the challenge within 30 seconds. Use the grappling hooks so that you don’t waste time climbing. Once you reach the end, attack the training dummy and hack into the system. The solution to the puzzle can be found in the image above.

2:48
Related
Wuthering Waves: How to Beat and Find The Lampylumen Myriad Echo Boss

The Lampylumen Myriad Echo Boss is a 4-Cost Overlord found in Wuthering Waves. Here's how you can defeat this Glacio Echo.

Explosive Barrel Puzzle

Next, head to a marker southwest in the Sea of Flames and find the wounded Exiles. This mission is relatively simple, as Rovers just need to test out the Explosive Spear Barrels. Exchange the filter from the previous mission with the Exiles to gain access to the Barrels. Unfortunately, the Barrels are located in a field of Incinero Petals, so your characters will burn the entire time.

There are multiple Barrels scattered across the field, and only three of them are the ones you're looking for. The Qualified Barrels are marked on the map, but getting to them is tough. You need to break all the Barrels you run into, because it provides you with immunity against the burn effect. The correct Barrels will not break when hit , so once you have found them, move on to the next lot. Beware of the Tacet Discords in the area.

Explosive Spear Testing In Sea Of Flames

Follow the quest marker until you once again have to go to the Sea of Flames to test out the spears. There will be three Sound Emulators that you must guard. Each one will attract TDs, and the only way to get rid of them is using the Explosive Spears.

You can do this with the help of the Levitator function in the Utility box, which will allow players to pick up the Spears and throw them at the TDs. The plus side of this mission is that players will not need to step onto the field of Incinero Petals. You can stay at an elevated height and throw each spear in the direction of the enemies.

Only sword users work on the spears.

How To Defeat The Inferno Rider

After following through with the navigation and story, you will eventually come to a point where you need to fight the Inferno Rider. It might help to eat some ATK-boosting food before entering the fight, as this boss is pretty tough to defeat .

  • The Inferno Rider on his bike has great mobility, and uses his body to lift the bike. You can usually time your dodges with this attack by dashing underneath the bike .
  • He also uses a flaming sword, which can deal significant damage. Keep an eye out and dodge this during the fight.
  • Halfway through the fight, if you manage to knock him off his bike, the Inferno Rider will abandon it and fight on both feet. This segment will bring a bunch of heavy hitters that can halve your HP if you don’t dodge them. The trick to surviving this is to keep an eye on the opportunity to parry your hits and land some combo attacks.
  • You can parry his attacks by hitting the rider exactly when you see a yellow circle around his chest. This will take a chunk off his shield and allow you to immobilize him more easily.
2:44
Related
Wuthering Waves: How To Beat and Find The Tempest Mephis Echo Boss

Follow this guide to find the Tempest Mephis Echo Boss in Wuthering Waves, and learn how to effectively manage its lightning attacks.

After winning the fight, absorb the Echo and transform into the Inferno Rider. You will need to r ide the Echo until the end of the Gravity Storm. There are three things you need to keep in mind during this challenge:

  • Use the Inferno Rider’s sword to cut down any obstacles in the way. This only applies to the boxes and crates on the road.
  • Use the slide button to duck beneath any billboards, metal railings, and giant balls of fire.
  • Remember to jump when you see a gap in the road as the challenge will automatically restart if you miss it.

Once this challenge is complete, the Incinero Petals will vanish from the Sea of Flames, and exploration in this area will be much easier. Head back to Jinzhou and talk to the necessary NPCs to complete the quest. You can now farm the Inferno Rider any time you want, and use its mount to traverse the planet.

item.title: Fallout 4: How to Change Pip-Boy Color
item.description:
Fallout 4 is an ever-popular game, something that will likely remain true for years to come. Despite the most recent next-gen update , Bethesda has failed to address some of the more pressing fan concerns. One problem that many players encounter is difficulty navigating the game's menus and UI. In fact, many players go through the entire game without knowing about some essential features, like changing the color of their Pip-Boy.

It is worth noting that this guide strictly focuses on changing the interface's color when interacting with the Pip-Boy, and it is not the same as changing the color of the flashlight. That being said, this guide will cover everything there is to know about changing the color scheme on the Pip-Boy, along with other useful information.

Related
Fallout 4 Player Fights Mama Murphy and Instantly Regrets It

Mama Murphy demonstrates her hand-to-hand expertise in a hilarious Fallout 4 clip where the Sole Survivor foolishly decides to pick a fight.

Changing Pip-Boy Color Scheme in Fallout 4

The Pip-Boy has a retro green screen in all modern Fallout games, which adds a bit of value to the world around you since it fits the aesthetic well. However, players can change the color scheme on their Pip-Boy at any time. To change the Pip-Boy Color Scheme, here follow these steps:

  1. Access the pause menu.
  2. Select Settings.
  3. Select Display.
  4. Scroll down until you get to the Pip-Boy Color R, Pip-Boy Color G, and Pip-Boy Color B.
  5. Adjust the sliders to get the color of your choice.

You cannot change the color scheme from the Pip-Boy menu.

Why Change the Default Pip-Boy Color Scheme in Fallout 4?

There are a couple of important reasons for changing the default Pip-Boy color scheme in Fallout 4 , such as:

  • To personalize your Pip-Boy as you see fit.
  • To make interacting with the Pip-Boy interface easier, especially if the text or map is unreadable for some.

All in all, you have everything you need to know about changing the color scheme on your Pip-Boy. It is worth noting players can change the Pip-Boy color scheme to the color of their choosing. Still, if you want to take things to the next level, you can install mods to enable multiple additional color options, have two different colors for the interface and flashlight, and more.

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong's Hornet Dialogue is a Double-Edged Sword
item.description:
Highlights

  • Silksong's protagonist is Hornet, who can speak and share her thoughts, changing character interactions in the game.
  • Hornet's ability to express emotions provides opportunities for character development that the silent Knight from the first game never had.
  • While Hornet may streamline Silksong's plot and make it easier to understand, it may sacrifice some of the mystery and personal connection of the original game.

Hollow Knight: Silksong is Team Cherry's opportunity to create a strong player-character with a personality that people can empathize with . Having Hornet as Silksong 's main protagonist means big changes compared to the previous game, specifically in character interactions. Hornet being able to speak and express her thoughts is better for overall character building, but this also means it might come up short of what Hollow Knight achieved with its silent protagonist.

During E3 2019, Hollow Knight: Silksong 's gameplay demo was presented during Nintendo Treehouse's live segment. It showed the new world that players will get to explore, enemies to face, and most importantly, a returning character called Hornet who players will get to control. Hollow Knight 's mysterious princess-protector gets the spotlight in Silksong , giving players a chance to see how her established personality harmonizes with the environments and inhabitants of Pharloom. Hornet's ability to produce dialogue and express emotions can have positive and negative consequences on the game's story and the player's perception of the world.

Related
Hollow Knight: Silksong Has a Challenging Tight Rope To Walk With Its Characters

To honor the game that came before it, Hollow Knight: Silksong will have to strike a specific balance with its cast of side characters.

The Potential of Hornet's Ability to Provide Dialogue

When comparing Hornet to The Knight , the clear difference is that Silksong 's protagonist can speak and share her thoughts about the different situations she finds herself in. Although those who have played Hollow Knight will already know about her selfless and relentless nature, the sequel will allow for further character development. Having a main protagonist that is not a blank slate gives Team Cherry more to work with regarding the kind of story it wants to tell. This allows for different opportunities, such as:

  • Different expressions that Hornet can show upon discovering the many areas of Pharloom
  • ​Character interactions that either synergize or clash with Hornet's personality
  • Hornet's personal thoughts on key events or items of significance to the plot

All of this can also aid Team Cherry in streamlining the plot, making it easier for the players to understand what is happening while seeing how the protagonist feels about the events unfolding. With everything known about Hornet prior to Silksong , composing a deep and meaningful narrative that effectively ties to her identity is highly likely.

Related
Hollow Knight: Silksong Could Be Foreshadowing a Tragic Ending in Plain Sight

Knowing how dark and melancholic the first game was, there might be an obvious clue that Hollow Knight: Silksong's story will tell a similar tale.

The Consequences of Hornet as a Speaking Protagonist

In the previous title, the world of Hollow Knight was filled with different areas and creatures that told a captivating story through both verbal and non-verbal means. The Knight's lack of a personality allowed players to form unfiltered connections with the world they were exploring and the story being told, making even the smallest details more personal. With Hornet being more vocal and expressive than her predecessor, players will see and feel everything from her perspective rather than just their own.

Having Hollow Knight 's main protagonist act as a link to the player allowed for immersive world-building, giving every action and interaction more meaning. Since Hornet is already established with her own character, the player will be compelled to go along with her thoughts and conclusions rather than formulating all of them themselves. Although this will make it easier for the developers to show how emotionally impacting certain key events or areas should be, it leaves less to the player's imagination.

While the question of when Hollow Knight: Silksong will be released remains unanswered, fans at least know that Silksong hopes to make Hornet an even more memorable figure than she already is. With Hornet's ability to speak, players will have an easier time understanding the sequel's narrative, giving her a storytelling edge over The Knight, albeit at the cost of some of the first game's identity.

item.title: 11 Video Games That Let You Ride Dragons
item.description:
Highlights

  • Video games offer diverse dragon-riding experiences beyond Skyrim, with earlier titles like Eragon featuring memorable dragon combat sequences.
  • World of Warcraft opens up the skies for players to own and ride dragons as MMO mounts, adding a vibrant mode of transport to the game.
  • From Monster Hunter Stories to Middle-earth: Shadow of War, players can ride dragon-like creatures, transforming gameplay with unique aerial combat options.

Gamers a few decades ago would likely associate a dragon with mythical beasts that serve as powerful monsters to defeat, or as companions to summon in games like Final Fantasy , while players today may immediately think of the Dragonborn of Skyrim that popularized the idea of dragon-riding to a more modern generation of video game fans. As such, gamers might be surprised to learn that video games where players can ride dragons go further back than the Bethesda title.

Related
Dungeons & Dragons: 22 Best Multiclassing Combinations

D&D's multiclassing system brings in a ton of creativity and flexibility. These are by far the best combos for players interested in multiclassing.

Much to the interest of dragon fans, certain video games do provide players with opportunities to make friends and ride their dragon companions to wage war on huge battlefields. While the premise of riding a dragon high up in the skies remains similar, their mechanics towards controlling their aerial beasts may differ in scope, complexity, and overall enjoyment.

Updated May 26, 2024 by Rhenn Taguiam: With Bethesda entering 2024 with a surprising update drop for The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim - Special Edition that provides players with some much-helpful quality-of-life fixes, fans of the franchise might be eager to scratch their dragon-riding itch beyond just touring the snowy region of northern Tamriel.

Thankfully, players can find various games where dragons become not just companions but also creatures to ride - giving them a full view of vast worlds alongside unique mechanics. Such games include a spin-off of a monster-hunting franchise, an RPG where getting a dragon companion is a subplot, a game with a Ghibli aesthetic, and a Lord of the Rings title where a ranger can possess a dragon as a mount.

1 Eragon

Rudimentary Dragon-Riding Levels

Release Date

November 14, 2006

Developer

Stormfront Studios, Amaze Entertainment

Platforms

Xbox 360, PS2, Xbox, PC, Nintendo DS, PSP, Game Boy Advance

Despite the poor reception of Eragon (both the game and the film), the game and its source novel’s central theme of Dragon Riders arrived in the title in the form of dragon-riding segments. Set in Alagaesia, Eragon stars the titular character as he discovers that the stone he’s kept at home is actually a dragon egg. After it hatches into the blue dragon Saphira, the pair are chased by the forces of the evil King Galbatorix.

While Eragon received poor reception for repetitive levels and forced dragon riding segments, its Saphira sections give players engaging fights against both ground units and fellow dragons. Traditional fire breaths and unique movements such as tailspins and Eragon’s own spells transform Saphira’s dragon-riding segments into memorable levels in the Eragon title.

2 World Of Warcraft

Ride Dragons As MMO Mounts

Given the vastness of the world of Azeroth in World of Warcraft , it only felt natural for its adventurers to ride mounts to travel across the MMO’s many biomes. After reaching Level 30, players can purchase flying mounts as well as the necessary license to make them fly. The sky’s the limit after reaching this point, as only certain areas in Azeroth remain license-locked for fliers, and dragons can be acquired as flying mounts by various means.

Unlike other games, players can’t “fight” while mounted, meaning dragons can only be used as a mode of transportation. As with other mounts in the game, dragons come in various forms and themes that allow players to have a mount that is as vibrant as their character. Among dragons to ride are winged four-limbed beings (Drakes), double-headed undead creatures (Chimaeras), Eastern serpentine-inspired lizards (Cloud Serpent), and robotic variants (Mechanical Dragons).

3 Monster Hunter Stories

Technically Ride Dragon-Looking Monsters

In the Monster Hunter spinoff Monster Hunter Stories , players take the form of Riders tasked with helping solve the mystery of the Black Blight that has ravaged monsters in the area. Whereas original Monster Hunter gameplay had players hunt various creatures, Monster Hunter Stories emphasizes forming bonds with them . Players bond with creatures named Monsties, each with unique abilities and “genes” that players can then use to breed their monsters.

However, perhaps most impressive about Monster Hunter stories is that Monsties can also be ridden by players, allowing them to explore zones without always encountering monsters. In the first game, nine Monsties have flying capabilities - chief among these are the series’ iconic dragon-looking monsters such as Rathalos, Rathian, Gravios, and Seregios.

4 Ni No Kuni: Wrath Of The White Witch

Ride A Dragon In A Ghibli-Inspired World

When Oliver of Motorville begins a quest in the Other World of Ni No Kuni: Wrath Of The White Witch to save his mother after her untimely death, he meets different companions who eventually help him on his journey. Among these is the purple wyvern Tengri, whose ability to fly is lost when his soulmate from the Real World loses his confidence. After finishing this side quest, Tengri becomes one of Oliver's few beastly companions, whose flight access vastly opens up Ni No Kuni ’s already impressive overworld .

Thanks to Tengri, players can now explore the overworld to their liking. Players can use a cursor to land almost anywhere on the map, giving them access to locations such as islands they can’t ordinarily explore and reach on foot. While Tengri only provides overworld exploration and not mounted combat, this wyvern adds a sense of verticality to the Ghibli-inspired aesthetics of the game.

5 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Ride NPC Dragons With Specific Directives

In a game like The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim where players become the Dragonborn, dragon-riding has become a much-desired feature that Bethesda eventually added via the Dragonborn DLC. While dragon riding isn’t a central mechanic in the open-world RPG, being able to tame the game’s most powerful apex predator can easily become a mark of a player’s supremacy.

Related
Best Third Party Books for D&D 5e, Ranked

The world of Dungeons and Dragons offers plenty of content, but these fan-made additions allow players to expand their worlds even more.

Players can only ride dragons in Skyrim upon acquiring the full Bend Will dragon shout consisting of Gol-Hah-Dov. However, as dragons have their own wills, players can only issue instructions to them but not necessarily control all of their movements. For instance, players can direct a dragon to attack a foe, switch their targets, or land. Moreover, due to how powerful dragons are in Tamriel, landing a dragon will revert the creature back into an NPC, where they can leave or even attack players.

6 Drakan: Order Of The Flame

Switch Between Ground And Aerial Fights With Ease

Release Date

August 20, 1999

Developer

Surreal Software

Platforms

PC

Tragedy strikes the warrior Rynn in Drakan: Order of the Flame , as not only did the evil Navaros kidnap her brother Delon, but he also burned their nearby village. Following the instructions of their elder, Rynn sought the help of the dragon Arokh in her quest to both save her brother and restore the Order of the Flame, which can vanquish the forces of evil.

Unlike other games with dragon riding mechanics , Drakan: Order of the Flame features both small-scale dungeons fit for Rynn and wide-open areas where both Rynn and Arokh can explore. Unique to the game is the freedom to transition to dragon riding in open spaces, as well as the demand for precision mechanics to ensure the accurate elimination of foes. When riding Arokh, Rynn can’t use anything but her potions and bow, while the dragon can use his fire breath as well as specially-built ranged armaments.

7 Lair

An Attempt At Large-Scale Fights With Motion Controls

Release Date

August 31, 2007

Developer

Factor 5

Platforms

PS3

Taking place in a world threatened by active volcanoes, Lair puts players in the role of Rohn Partridge, a dragon rider Burner in the air force Sky Guards of Asylia tasked to defend the land from the isolated Mokai. While the game’s dependence on the PlayStation 3’s Six-Axis motion controls led to a heavily criticized control scheme, its emphasis on dragon riding makes it a standout in this particular theme.

Related
Fire Emblem: 7 Best Dragons, Ranked

There are many dragons in the Fire Emblem franchise. Here are the ones who stand out most.

Some aspects of Lair need Rohn to land on the ground and fight enemies in melee combat, but a majority of the game takes place in the skies. Players have to tilt their controller to maneuver their dragon, much in the same way a horse has to be reined when issuing commands. In combat, Lair needs players to be at the same height as the enemy combatant, while they can also quickly move the controller to redirect their dragons elsewhere.

8 Pathfinder: Wrath Of The Righteous

Ride A Dragon In The Endgame Unless With Certain Conditions

As Wrath of the Righteous players save the Worldmound from being destroyed by demonic forces, their adventures will eventually have them choose one of ten Mythic Paths . Should they become the mystic rebels of the Azata, they will eventually encounter a Dragon Companion named Aivu whose combat prowess and access to spells can provide the team with a dependable spellcaster.

However, what makes the Azata and Aivu fun to play with would be the option to ride Aivu into battle. Should the Azata get to Small size (be it with their Race or another spell), they can ride Aivu as soon as she turns into a Medium-sized creature throughout leveling up. While Aivu doesn’t exactly fly, she remains one of the few ways a player can ride dragons in any tactical RPG that doesn’t default into a preset unit that is both a person and a dragon combined.

9 Middle-earth: Shadow Of War

Dominate The Skies With A Powerful Drake

While exploring Mordor as the tag team of Ranger Talion and Spirit Celebrimbor already makes Middle-earth: Shadow of War a gripping action take on the Lord of the Rings franchise, players can take things a step further with Mounted Skills. This part of the player’s skill tree allows them to call specific mounts and even ride them in the right conditions. Should players invest in their skill points properly and finish the Carnan questline, they may be able to call a dragon for them to mount.

Compared to mountable Caragors and Graugs, riding a dragon immediately turns any battle in the player’s favor. From the perspective of the skies, Shadow of War ’s open world becomes rather minuscule. Targeting foes becomes a breeze when a dragon can take players to their destination in seconds, and unleashing dragonfire onto opponents can make encounters much easier.

10 Panzer Dragoon

Fight Enemies From All Directions With Various Armaments

Despite numerous entries in the dragon-riding Panzer Dragoon franchise, the first Panzer Dragoon game showcases the potential of the genre as a role-playing rail shooter. Set in the distant future, protagonist Keil Fluge is thrust into a high-stakes quest as he’s forced to link up with a blue dragon and chase a black dragon before it reaches the black tower.

While the Panzer Dragoon story only takes place across six short levels , the game’s mechanics give players thrilling action sequences against hordes of enemies. Players can look in all directions to see where enemies such as dragonflies, wasps, sandworms, and even battleships are coming from. With a black dragon left to chase, players need to decide quickly whether to accurately target foes with their handgun or use the dragon’s multi-hit attack to fight multiple enemies at once.

11 Century: Age Of Ashes

Ride Dragons In High-Octane Sky Fights

Release Date

November 18, 2021

Developer

Playwing

Platforms

PS4, GeForce Now, Android, Xbox One, PS5

Players who wanted to engage in brutal combat atop stunning dragons could do so without impunity in Century: Age of Ashes . Players take on the role of Dragoneers as they engage in five game modes, most of which involve fierce skyward battles against other Dragoneers, while others integrate mechanics such as tower defense and point capture. Central to Century: Age of Ashes are its dragons, as players can choose dragon variants according to their class.

Aside from class-independent mounts such as the stocky Strongscale and the eagle-like Cloudsplitter, players can use bulky mounts for frontline attacks (Marauder with Bloodchaser), weather-resistant dragons for long-ranged abilities (Stormraiser with Stonesnout), or wood-like dragons for spellcasters (Thornweaver with Vinedrake). There are also dedicated class-mount pairs, such as fast fliers for support players (Windguard with Ironwing), and sleek dragons for stealth attackers (Phantom with Nightsnagger).

More
The Best Games That Let You Play As A Dragon

Want to feel mighty and breathe fire? These wonderful video games allow players to become powerful dragons.
